Indinesia: Nahdlatul Ulama and Muhammadiyah, the largest Muslim organisations in Indonesia, issue joint statements critical of militant Islamists.
Peace talks in Malino, South Sulawesi appear to end three years of Christian-Muslim violence in Maluku and Poso.
Tommy Suharto is sentenced to fifteen years jail for illegal possession of arms, contempt of law, and masterminding the assassination of a Supreme Court judge who had convicted him for graft.
House Speaker Akbar Tandjung is sentenced to three years jail for corruption.

Bombs in the Kuta nightclub district in Bali kill 202 people, the world's deadliest terrorist attack since 11 September 2001. Indonesian police, aided by ten nations, track down Jemaah Islamiyah operatives.
Eurico Guterres is sentenced to ten years prison for crimes committed following the 1999 ballot in East Timor.
The Indonesian government and GAM sign a peace accord aimed at ending decades of violence in Aceh. The deal breaks down the following year.
